item.title: Work on polyproto and a "vacation" ⛱️
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
Work on polyproto and taking a break

In this little update post I write about what I've done in the last couple of weeks alongside talking about taking just a little break(don't worry, y'all are not getting rid of me!)

item.title: Self-updating structs, moving blog posts to GitHub, and more!
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
Self-updating structs, moving blog posts to GitHub, and more!

Introducing self-updating structs, explaining how they work, and what they are good for. Also, moving blog posts to GitHub, and other improvements.

item.title: chorus Alpha 0.1.0
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
chorus Alpha 0.1.0

We are alpha now! As of 2 days ago, the first Alpha of Chorus, Version 0.1.0, has been released for everyone to look at and use on crates.io!

item.title: Getting started with the Polyphony Client
item.author: bitfl0wer

item.title: Porting chorus to WebAssembly + Client Update
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
Porting chorus to WebAssembly + Client Update

What the current state of GUI libraries in Rust means for Polyphony and chorus, and why we are porting chorus to WebAssembly.

item.title: X.509 in polyproto
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
Certificates, please: X.509 in polyproto

This blog post covers a bit about how and why X.509 is used in polyproto, and how we try to makethe process of implementing your own server and incorporating it into an existing network a littleeasier.

item.title: Account migration in polyproto
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description: Account migration is an important and difficult thing to get right in federated systems. In this blogpost, I will outline how I imagine account migration to work in polyproto, and what benefits thisapproach brings.
